Pre-Game Insights: Out-of-sorts Pakistan know that they are in a must-win situation when they face Canada in match 22 of the ICC T20 World Cup.
Pakistan must defeat both Canada and Ireland to have any chance of progressing to the Super Eights whilst also hoping that USA slip up elsewhere.
The Maple Leafers, meanwhile, are in third place in Group A with two points in as many games.

Being the lowest-ranked team in the tournament, it's fair to say that not much was expected from them, but they pulled off one of the greatest wins in their cricketing history last time out as they stunned Ireland by 12 runs last Friday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The ICC Men's T20 World Cup is back with its ninth edition in 2024, making it a historic event, as it takes place for the first time in the United States and the West Indies.
This year's expanded T20 World Cup sees 20 teams competing for the first time in its 17-year history.
The 20 sides have been split into four groups, with the top two then advancing to the Super 8 round.
The Super 8s comprises of two groups, with the top two reaching the semi-finals. The final match is set for June 29.
The T20 Cricket World Cup is being held across nine venues in the West Indies and the United States, hosting a total of 55 games.

This tournament marks cricket's first major global event in the U.S., with 16 matches set to be played across three American venues: Central Broward Park & Broward County Stadium in Florida, Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York, and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.
Meanwhile, six nations from the West Indies will also play host: Antigua and Barbuda, Barbados, Guyana, Saint Lucia, St. Vincent and the Grenadines, and Trinidad and Tobago.
